pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the Maple2 server project, its goals, constraints, and a high-level walkthrough of server architecture, data flow, and runtime execution

pages.title: Server Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain the distributed server topology and responsibility boundaries between Login, World, and Game servers

pages.title: Login Server
pages.purpose: Detail authentication, character creation, selection, deletion, and migration initiation

pages.title: World Server
pages.purpose: Explain global coordination responsibilities including migration tokens, distributed locking, player presence, and social systems

pages.title: Game Server
pages.purpose: Describe the game server runtime environment including session management, field instances, and real-time simulation

pages.title: Networking and Migration
pages.purpose: Detail packet handling, encryption, inter-server communication, and the token-based migration flow between servers

pages.title: Data Pipeline
pages.purpose: Explain how proprietary game assets are transformed into structured metadata and runtime-accessible data

pages.title: Content Ingestion
pages.purpose: Detail file parsing, type mappers, checksum-based ingestion, and database population

pages.title: Map Data Processing
pages.purpose: Explain extraction of map entities, spawns, portals, triggers, and spatial metadata from XBlock files

pages.title: Metadata Storage
pages.purpose: Describe metadata access patterns, lazy loading, caching strategies, and separation between static and mutable data

pages.title: Game Session
pages.purpose: Describe GameSession as the authoritative per-player runtime context and coordination hub

pages.title: Session Lifecycle
pages.purpose: Explain session creation during migration, initialization order, and disposal and cleanup

pages.title: Session Managers
pages.purpose: Detail the manager pattern and responsibilities of core managers such as Item, Quest, Currency, Stats, Buff, and Achievement

pages.title: Persistence and Migration
pages.purpose: Explain player data persistence, migration saves, distributed locking, and cross-server consistency guarantees

pages.title: Game World
pages.purpose: Provide an overview of world simulation, field instances, and entity management

pages.title: Field Manager
pages.purpose: Detail field instance lifecycle, update loop, threading model, packet processing, and entity orchestration

pages.title: Actor System
pages.purpose: Explain the IActor hierarchy, combat execution, skills, buffs, and interaction logic

pages.title: Navigation and AI
pages.purpose: Detail pathfinding with DotRecast, NPC AI state machines, and movement systems

pages.title: Trigger System
pages.purpose: Explain trigger state machines, TriggerContext actions, and scripted map events

pages.title: Map Entities
pages.purpose: Detail static world elements such as portals, spawn points, and interactable objects

pages.title: Player Systems
pages.purpose: Provide an overview of player-centric mechanics and progression systems

pages.title: Inventory System
pages.purpose: Detail inventory management, item collections, transactions, and concurrency considerations

pages.title: Item Enhancement and Sockets
pages.purpose: Explain enchantments, gemstones, limit breaks, and enhancement workflows

pages.title: Character Progression
pages.purpose: Detail stats, leveling, mastery, achievements, and attribute calculation

pages.title: Condition System
pages.purpose: Explain condition evaluation used by quests, achievements, and triggers

pages.title: Development and Administration
pages.purpose: Cover operational, debugging, and maintenance concerns

pages.title: Project Structure and Dependencies
pages.purpose: Detail repository layout, build configuration, and external dependencies

pages.title: Administrative Commands
pages.purpose: Explain command infrastructure for debugging, moderation, and live state manipulation
